`pipeline` is an object with `name` and `id` attributes. So you would need to do `dynamic_page_hubdb_row.pipeline.name`

a
`pipeline` is an object with `name` and `id` attributes. So you would need to do `dynamic_page_hubdb_row.pipeline.name`

Hey <@UE8RUSAUT>, the 'parent' page of your dynamic pages should appear in the sitemap UI in HubSpot. If you look at the actual sitemap.xml URL, you should see the dynamic pages in there. You should also be able to see analytics for the dynamic pages in the website/landing pages dashboards.

Hey community, here is a HubDB question

I'm creating multilevel dynamic pages with two tables PROJECTS and a child table SUBPROJECTS
So my architecture is this one :

Projects > Projects Item containing SubProjects List > Subproject Items

I want to create a dynamic breadcrumb
When I'm on a subproject item how can I know the previous paths by getting parent name and url ?

I don't know if I totally clear... Sorry if I'm not
You can use `.parentRow`
Thanks
I will try
Wait
`hs_parent_row`
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-variables>
Ok thanks I will try and keep you in touch
Which you can see in use here <https://designers.HubSpot.com/how-to-build-multilevel-dynamic-templates>
Yes I'm on it also

It works when i'm on a child list
But when I'm on a item (dynamic_page_hubdb_row) how to access to parent list ?
As in all the rows in the parent table?

Project List (dynamic list) > Project Item (dynamic item)
When I'm on project item How can I access to the list (name, path...) ?
Example HubL snippet with what you have now would be useful

Hey community! I’m trying to write (what I hope is a simple) if statement on the dynamically generated page, using a column.

If the value in that column for that row is *x* then show this. If the value in that column is *y* then show that. Essentially, toggling out which form is embedded on this page <https://www.deluxemodular.com/careers-hubdb/general-labor> based on a value in the row.

Still new to all this, so I was trying something like

`{% if column.category.id == '7933665908' %}`

but that’s not the way to go. Any help or examples is greatly appreciated.
Yes, they are.
Which will be cool until the message is not one of the 10,000 most recent posts and gets hidden. :disappointed:
